text:
Park Row, north from Mail Street (on the left), to the Brooklyn Bridge. A portion of Nassau Street, is observed on the far side of triangular plot, with the statue of Benjamin Franklin thereon. This section of the City just east of City Hall Park, is known as Printing House Square, as at this date, the newspaper publication of the City was centered here.

About 1880.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Mail Street

text:
General View:  Park Row and Frankfort Street.  From the Pulitzer Building looking south Bedloes Island and the Statue of Liberty are discernible at right, facing the Jersey Shore.

Charles L. Nitzmann
New York City.

King 1890!
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

text:
Park Row, east side, at Frankfort Street, as seen from across City Hall Park. The view shows a portion of the City Hall on the right and the Pulitzer Building (also known as the "World" Building.) in the background.

About 1899.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

text:
Park Row, east side, south from and including Frankfort Street, to, but not including Broadway. Also shown is Nassau Street, south from Park Row, to and including Fulton Street.

About 1894.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

text:
53-63 Park Row, (Pulitzer or World Building), at the N. E. corner of Frankfort Street, showing a general view eastward of the Brooklyn Bridge, environs, the East River and the Brooklyn shore. The foreground area is the industrial section popularly known as the "Swamp." Dominant there is the 10-story Healy Building and the Shot Tower. The former is at Gold and Ferry Streets, while the latter is at Cliff and Beekman Streets. Thru the left midground runs Cherry Street, a one time fashionable thoroughfare that parallels the water front.

J. S. Johnston photo
Copyright 1894
Ewing Galloway

1894
title: Bridges - Brooklyn Bridge.

text:
City Hall Park: An unidentified occasion at the City Hall. Possibly the ceremonies attendant to the Subway construction at this point. Note in the background the Pulitzer Building at the N.E. corner of Park Row and Frankfort Street.

About 1901.
title: Manhattan: City Hall Park - [Park Row - Frankfort Street.]

text:
Park Row, east side, north from and including Frankfort Street, to and including The Brooklyn Bridge Approach, near North William Street. Also shown is Nassau Street, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of Frankfort Street. In the foreground, is shown a portion of City Hall Park, with a part of the City Hall. The Municipal Building is seen towering above the Second and Third Aves., Elevated Brooklyn Bridge Station extension. Adjoining said station on the south, is the Pulitzer Building, (also known as the "World Building"). A portion of the Tribune Building, is shown on the extreme right.

About 1925.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

text:
Street Scene, Miscellaneous: A public minded individual cooperating in maintaining clean streets. This photograph taken on Center Street shows City Hall Park in the background.

About 1930.
title: Street scenes - Miscellaneous.

text:
Park Row, east side, at Frankfort Street, as seen from across City Hall Park. The view shows a portion of the City Hall on the right and the Pulitzer Building (also known as the "World" Building) in the background.

June 24, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

text:
(1) Park ROW, north from Frankfort Street, to the Brooklyn Bridge. The view shows the Brooklyn Bridge Extension of the Second and Third Avenue Elevated, over Park Row, to City Hall Park. Prominent in the background, is the Municipal Building. On the right appears the World (Pulitzer) Building.

April 18, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view.

April 18, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same area subsequent to the removal of the aforementioned pedestrian over-approach to the Bridge. Remaining is the "El" station and the train shed from which formerly all Brooklyn traffic started. Beyond same is the New York Herald building and statuette on North William Street. Note the automobile entrance to the Bridge adjoining the World Building.

July 4, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

Everything visible so

title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

text:
City Hall Park: A view of the City Hall, as seen from frankfort Street and viewing westward across Park Row. In the background appear the Postal Telegraph & Cable and the Home Life Insurance Company buildings; both on Broadway, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Murray Street. This is a set consisting of two views.

About 1936.

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad F.R.P.S.
title: Manhattan: Frankfort Street - Park Row

text:
City Hall Park: A view of the City Hall, as seen from frankfort Street and viewing westward across Park Row. In the background appear the Postal Telegraph & Cable and the Home Life Insurance Company buildings; both on Broadway, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Murray Street. This is a set consisting of two views.

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad F.R.P.S.
title: Manhattan: Frankfort Street - Park Row

text:
General View of Lower Manhattan: looking north from Pulitzer Building over Manhattan. The building located at Park Row and Frankfort Streets.

Charles L. Ritzmann
title: General view - Lower Manhattan.
